text: I raised a hand to stop Lucia and whispered, “Don’t move. I’ll hold them off—find a way to reach the mentor.”
Her eyes widened, lips pale. “Are you insane?!”
I took a deep breath and stepped out of the shadows. The blue light from the floor reflected across my face as I raised my empty hand.
Lucia retreated back into the darkness, leaving me face-to-face with the cult leader.
“Don’t misunderstand,” I said, forcing my voice to stay calm. “We’re not enemies. I only want to know—if she’s still alive.”
The robed leader slowly turned his head, his voice grinding like stone against metal. “Alive or dead, it makes no difference. Mortal, do not meddle with the order of echoes.”
🎲 [Charisma Check: Failed] Your voice trembles slightly—he catches the hesitation beneath your words.
“Stalling?” He sneered. “You can’t even lie properly.”
The blue light surged, the runes on the ground pulsing like a heartbeat.
My chest tightened. The air warped, heat waves rolling outward.
A whip of light lashed out, striking me square in the chest.
Pain burst through my chest, flinging me backward. The taste of iron filled my mouth.
Lucia charged from the shadows, her staff blazing with light, placing herself between me and the enemy.
“Stop!” she shouted, her voice almost drowned out by the roar of the flames.
A golden wall of light flared before us, blocking the next wave of attacks.
But the ritual’s glow began to spiral out of control—blue fire spreading along the floor as if to devour the entire chamber.
The leader’s laughter echoed within the flames. “The Cycle must be fulfilled! Even if it demands flesh as the price!”
He raised both hands, the runes beneath him blazing ever brighter.
Lucia shouted back, “Over my dead body!”
Her spell ripped through the air, the barrier expanding and separating me from Alicia.
“Lucia! Unlock it!” I screamed.
Her staff flared with brilliant light. The runes on the chains cracked and began to shatter.
The leader sensed the disturbance, but the ritual was already collapsing—energy surging out of control.
Blue light exploded, the shockwave consuming everything around us.
When I forced my eyes open, the cultists were gone—only Alicia and Lucia remained, lying unconscious among the rubble.
“...Thank you...” she murmured faintly in her sleep.
Wind poured in through the collapsed entrance. Snowflakes drifted down onto her face, as if gently covering her from the world.
I gave a bitter smile. Fate was never fair.
